snippet: A 132-0 vote in Congress was the culmination of a tumultuous five months since prosecutors revealed the existence of a customs fraud ring.
abstract: Guatemala's Congress votes unanimously to strip Pres Otto Perez Molina of his immunity from prosecution; vote comes five months after prosecutors made public the existence of customs fraud ring that effectively stole millions from public coffers, sparking weekly public demonstrations.

byline.original: By ELISABETH MALKIN and AZAM AHMED

lead_paragraph: A 132-0 vote in Congress was the culmination of a tumultuous five months since prosecutors revealed the existence of a customs fraud ring.

headline.main: President Otto Pérez Molina Is Stripped of Immunity in Guatemala
headline.print_headline: President Is Stripped of Immunity in Guatemala
